alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 12:48PM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY... ...GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY... .An Arctic air mass will continue to support dangerously cold wind chills over western South Dakota and northeastern Wyoming through the week. The coldest wind chills are expected to occur Wednesday through Friday, as a quick-moving storm system crosses the region. This system will also bring a quick shot of snow, which, combined with strong northwest winds, could lead to significant blowing of snow. As a result, ground blizzard conditions will be possible Wednesday through early Friday, especially over the South Dakota plains. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of the Black Hills of South Dakota and northeast and the Black Hills of Wyoming. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds late Wednesday into Thursday will produce areas of blowing snow. Visibility may be significantly reduced at times.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. A wind chill advisory means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills
